meanings.definition: Not loaded or carried on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The unshipped cargo remained on the dock.
meanings.sent2: The unshipped goods were still waiting to be loaded onto the vessel.
meanings.sent3: The unshipped packages sat sadly by the port, longing for their voyage.
meanings.sent4: The unshipped containers felt abandoned, left behind while others sailed away.
meanings.sent5: The image of the unshipped crates under the open sky was a reminder of delayed journeys.

meanings.definition: To remove from a ship or cargo.
meanings.sent1: The workers unshipped the crates carefully to avoid any damage.
meanings.sent2: They unshipped the cargo swiftly to make space for new shipments.
meanings.sent3: As a prank, they unshipped the captain's chair and hid it on the deck.
meanings.sent4: The crew had to unship the supplies quickly during the storm to prevent them from falling overboard.
meanings.sent5: The decision to unship the damaged goods saved the rest of the cargo from spoilage.
